We reported the first patient with GS2 in Thailand. The patient was compound heterozygous for two novel mutations, c.109A>T (p.K37X) and c.318T>G (p.S106R). We reported the first case of a successful prenatal diagnosis for GS2. The result revealed that the fetus carried the p.K37X, but not the p.S106R (Fig. C), suggesting that the fetus would be unaffected with GS2.

wikipathways.name: Deregulation of Rab and Rab Effector Genes in Bladder Cancer
Inhibition of exosome biogenesis and secretion by Manumycin A in CRPC cells

summary: The protein encoded by this gene belongs to the small GTPase superfamily, Rab family. The protein is membrane-bound and may be involved in protein transport and small GTPase mediated signal transduction. Mutations in this gene are associated with Griscelli syndrome type 2. Alternative splicing occurs at this locus and four transcript variants encoding the same protein have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
